Memory of Kim Il Sung honored in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Memory of Kim Il Sung honored in Bangladesh
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the National Committee of Bangladesh to honor the memory of the President Kim Il Sung was held on June 15 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his death.   The conveyor of the c.c., Socialist Party of Bangladesh at the meeting stressed that the respected President Kim Il Sung was the great leader who made an immortal contribution to the Korean and world revolution, and the great teacher of the era of independence who devoted all his life to the cause of human liberation.   The meeting decided to hold colorful events on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the death of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Letter at UN Distributed as UNSC document
articles.content:
Letter at UN Distributed as UNSC document
   Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK permanent representative at the United Nations sent a letter to the president of the UN Security Council on June 18 as regards the grave situation  prevailing on the Korean peninsula due to the armed conflict triggered off by the South Korean authorities in the West Sea of Korea under the U.S. patronage.
   The letter was distributed on June 21 as an official document of the UNSC s1999693.

articles.title: U.S. cruisers arrive in S. Korean waters for joint drill
articles.content:
U.S. cruisers arrive in S. Korean waters for joint drill
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Two U.S. missile-guided cruisers--Mobile Bay and Vincennes--arrived in South Korean waters, leaving Japan's Yokosuka base on June 17, a foreign news report said.   The two cruisers are reported to enter the port of Pusan on Thursday and have a joint drill with the South Korean Navy next Monday.   Such reinforcement and maneuvers by the U.S. and the South Korean authorities are intended to retrieve themselves from their defeat in the engagement in the West Sea of Korea and unleash a war at any cost.

articles.title: Cause of Korean people supported abroad
Solidarity with Korean people expressed
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean people expressed 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people was sponsored by the organization of solidarity of the peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America at its building on June 9.   At the meeting the secretary general of the organization said that true to the cause of the respected Kim Il Sung, the great Kim Jong Il leads the building of a powerful nation, smashing the isolation and suffocation moves of the imperialists including the United States. His leadership serves as a banner encouraging the struggle of the world revolutionary people, the speaker added.   
   A representative of the Palestinian National Liberation Front said that the United States, the "only superpower," dares not provoke socialist Korea because it is afraid of the strength of the Korean people single-heartedly united around Kim Jong Il.
   The first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification said that they would more widely conduct the international solidarity movement whereby to press the U.S. to replace the Korean armistice agreement with a peace accord and withdraw its forces from South Korea and bring earlier Korea's reunification.

Korean books presented to India
articles.content:
Korean books presented to India
   Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of presenting Korean books was held at the building of the Center of Indian Trade Unions on June 18.
   The DPRK ambassador to India handed the secretary of the center works of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, including vol.3 of part I-the anti-Japanese revolution of "With the Century", reminiscences of the President,  and the General Secretary's famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation", and other Korean books.
   Saying the books will serve as a spiritual weapon for them, the secretary of the center said they would deeply study and embody them in activities of the trade unions.

articles.title: Annual meeting of Guyana committee
articles.content:
Annual meeting of Guyana committee
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Guyana Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification was held in Georgetown on June 15.   The meeting reviewed the committee's past activities and discussed the future working plan. Minister of Amerindian Affairs Bivert Desuza was elected Honorary Chairman and secretary general of the Justices of the Peace Association of Guyana Sabid Bacchus chairman of the committee.
   A solidarity letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

Greetings to Madagascan  President
articles.content:
Greetings to Madagascan  President
   Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Thursday sent a message of greetings to Didier Ratsiraka, President of Madagascar, on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of its independence.
   It expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations existing between the two countries would further strengthen and develop and sincerely wished the Madagascan  President and people greater success in their work for the independent development of the country and its prosperity.
